ğŸ“… 2026-02-12 | AIê°€ ë¶„ì„í•œ ì˜¤ëŠ˜ì˜ AI ë‰´ìŠ¤

  1. Analyze the User's Request:

    • Role: AI Expert Analyst.
    • Task: Select the top 3 most important and influential AI-related news items from the provided list.
    • Format per news item:
      • ## [Number] Title
      • **Key Content** (5-6 lines): Detailed explanation of the tech/service/policy.
      • **Why Important** (2-3 lines): Why the industry cares.
      • **Expert Opinion** (3-4 lines): Pros/cons, future outlook.
      • **Our Usage Plan** (3-4 lines): Practical ideas for seniors, small businesses, creators.
    • Selection Criteria:
      • 1st Priority: Generative AI (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.).
      • 2nd Priority: AI Policy, Regulation, Investment.
      • 3rd Priority: New AI Tech, Robots, Autonomous Driving.
    • Tone: Polite (ì¡´ëŒ“ë§), easy to understand for non-experts.
    • Special Requirement: Explain technical terms in parentheses.

  2. Analyze the Provided News List (Filtering & Prioritizing):

    • 1. Animal disease (AI as avian influenza) -> Not AI technology, it's a disease acronym. Ignore.
    • 2. Busan Port 'AI Grand Transformation' -> AI application in logistics. Priority 3.
    • 3. SME Ministry, Public Data AI Challenge -> Policy/Investment support. Priority 2.
    • 4. Cardiovascular exam records AI auto-organizing -> AI in Healthcare. Priority 3.
    • 5. Samsung/Telcos, Real-time voice phishing detection during calls -> AI Security/Application. Important for safety, but maybe less "industry-shifting" than generative AI, though highly relevant to daily life.
    • 6. Investment in AI security unicorn (135 billion won) -> Policy/Investment. Priority 2.
    • 7. Forest Science Institute, AI Wildfire Response -> AI in Disaster Management. Priority 3.
    • 8. Kakao x Google AI partnership -> Generative AI/Big Tech. High impact (Kakao is a major Korean tech giant, Google is global). Priority 1.
    • 9. KENTECH-KEPCO Energy AI research -> AI Research. Niche. Lower priority.
    • 10. Semiconductor AIX Forum -> Semiconductor/AI hardware. Important, but a forum announcement rather than a breakthrough.
    • 11. Busan multicultural students AI translation -> AI application in education. Good for social impact, but lower "industry influence" compared to #8 or #12.
    • 12. Yangcheon-gu, 'Y-GPT' administrative AI platform -> Generative AI in the public sector (specifically local government). Very relevant trend (Agentic AI/Government usage). Priority 1.
    • 13. Micron HBM4 shipment -> AI Hardware (Memory). Very important for AI infrastructure (Nvidia connection). Priority 3 (or higher, but the prompt prioritizes GenAI/Policy over hardware specifically). Let's keep it as a strong candidate.
    • 14 & 15 (Duplicates) -> Ignore.

  3. Select Top 3:

    • Candidate 1: News #8 (Kakao x Google).

      • Why: Fits "Generative AI". Major strategic partnership. "Google Gemini" models integrated into Kakao services. Huge impact on Korean market.

    • Candidate 2: News #12 (Yangcheon-gu 'Y-GPT').

      • Why: Fits "Generative AI". Represents the trend of "Public Sector GenAI" or "Local Governments adopting LLMs". Very relatable to the "Usage Plan" (administration, citizen services).

    • Candidate 3: News #5 (Samsung/Telcos Real-time Voice Phishing Detection) OR News #2 (Busan Port).

      • Let's look at the criteria again. 2nd priority is Policy/Investment. 3rd is New Tech.
      • News #5 is very practical and "influential" right now due to phishing issues. It uses AI (Deepfake detection/Voice analysis).
      • News #2 is about "Smart Port".
      • News #6 is about investment.
      • News #13 is about HBM (Hardware).
      • Decision: News #8 is a must. News #12 is a great example of GenAI adoption.
      • For the 3rd slot, I want something impactful.
        • News #5: Safety is huge. AI detecting voice phishing in real-time is a major "AI Tech" application that affects everyone.
        • News #13: HBM4 is critical for AI running, but maybe less "applicable" to the specific user groups (seniors, small business, creators) mentioned in the "Usage Plan" section.
        • News #4: Medical AI is interesting.
        • Let's go with News #5 (Voice Phishing) or News #2 (Busan Port)? The prompt asks for "Influential".
        • Actually, looking at the list, News #3 (Public Data AI Challenge) fits "Policy/Investment" well, supporting startups.
        • But News #8 (Kakao) and News #12 (Y-GPT) are strong Generative AI picks.
        • Let's pick #8 Kakao x Google, #12 Yangcheon-gu Y-GPT, and #5 Samsung Voice Phishing Detection.
          • #8: Global partnership, GenAI.
          • #12: Local gov, GenAI.
          • #5: Security, immediate practical application of AI (AI detection tech).

    • Alternative Consideration: What about #13 Micron HBM4? It's the backbone of AI. If I skip it, am I missing the "infrastructure" aspect? The prompt asks for "Influential AI related news". HBM4 defines AI capability limits. However, the "Usage Plan" (seniors, small biz, creators) is hard to write for Micron. I'll stick to service/application layer news for better "Usage Plan" generation.

    • Refined Selection:

      1. [AIí”½] ì¹´ì¹´ì˜¤, êµ¬ê¸€ê³¼ AI 'ë§ì†'â€¦ì •ì‹ ì•„ "í´ë¼ìš°ë“œÂ·ê¸€ë˜ìŠ¤ë„ í˜‘ì—…" (News #8) -> Generative AI / Big Tech
      2. ì–‘ì²œêµ¬, í–‰ì • ì „ìš© AI í”Œë«í¼ 'Y-GPT' ë„ì… (News #12) -> Generative AI / Public Service
      3. ì‚¼ì„±Â·ì´í†µ3ì‚¬, í†µí™” ì¤‘ ì‹¤ì‹œê°„ ë³´ì´ìŠ¤í”¼ì‹± íƒì§€Â·ì•Œë¦¼ ì œê³µ (News #5) -> AI Security / Practical Tech (Replaces HBM for applicability).

    • Self-Correction on Priority: The prompt says 1st is Generative AI. 2nd is Policy. 3rd is Tech.

    • I have two GenAI news. For the third, News #3 (Policy/Challenge) fits the criteria well. But News #5 is "New AI Tech" (Priority 3) and arguably more impactful to the general public than a startup challenge. I will stick with News #5 as the 3rd pick because "Real-time detection" is a significant AI advancement in the security field.

  4. Drafting Content (Iterative refinement for tone and clarity):

    • News 1: Kakao & Google

      • Content: Kakao partners with Google. Using Google's AI infrastructure and models (like Gemini) to improve Kakao's services. Collaboration on cloud and smart glasses too.
      • Importance: It's a major shift for a Korean Big Tech to partner deeply with Google. It speeds up Kakao's AI development significantly.
      • Expert: Pros: Kakao gets tech fast, Google gets data/market. Cons: Dependence on foreign tech. Future: Better Korean LLM (Large Language Model).
      • Usage: Small businesses using Kakao Talk channels for better chatbots. Creators using AI tools for content.

    • News 2: Yangcheon-gu 'Y-GPT'

      • Content: Yangcheon-gu introduces 'Y-GPT', a generative AI model customized for administrative work. It helps write documents, summarize civil complaints, and answer citizen questions.
      • Importance: First local government in Korea to introduce its own GenAI brand. Sets a precedent for digital transformation in the public sector.
      • Expert: Pros: Efficiency, 24/7 service. Cons: Privacy/Security risks with personal data. Future: More local govts will adopt this.
      • Usage: Seniors can ask complex administrative questions easily. Small businesses can get instant info on local business laws.

    • News 3: Samsung/Telcos Real-time Phishing Detection

      • Content: Collaboration to detect voice phishing during calls. AI analyzes voice patterns and scripts in real-time to alert the user before damage occurs.
      • Importance: Voice phishing is getting more sophisticated (AI voice cloning). This is a crucial defense mechanism using AI vs AI.
      • Expert: Pros: High protection, immediate alert. Cons: False positives (blocking legit calls). Future: Standard feature on all phones.
      • Usage: Seniors (primary target) are protected. Small businesses avoid financial loss from scams.

  5. Final Polish (Language and Formatting):

    • Ensure polite endings (~~í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤, ~ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤).
    • Check line counts for each section.
    • Verify explanations of terms (e.g., LLM, Generative AI, Cloud).

    (Self-Correction during drafting): For Kakao news, ensure I explain "Cloud" and "AI models" simply. For Y-GPT, explain "Generative AI" in context of admin work. For Phishing, explain "AI analysis".

  6. Final Output Generation (Proceeding to generate the Korean response).

    • Drafting News 1: ## [1] ì¹´ì¹´ì˜¤, êµ¬ê¸€ê³¼ AI 'ë§ì†'... ê¸€ë¡œë²Œ í˜‘ì—… ë³¸ê²©í™”
    • Drafting News 2: ## [2] ì–‘ì²œêµ¬, í–‰ì • ì „ìš© AI í”Œë«í¼ 'Y-GPT' ë„ì…
    • Drafting News 3: ## [3] ì‚¼ì„±Â·ì´í†µ3ì‚¬, í†µí™” ì¤‘ ì‹¤ì‹œê°„ ë³´ì´ìŠ¤í”¼ì‹± íƒì§€Â·ì•Œë¦¼ ì œê³µ

  7. Review against constraints:

    • 3 news items? Yes.
    • Format correct? Yes.
    • Line counts adhered to? Yes.
    • Priority criteria followed? Yes (2 GenAI, 1 Tech application).
    • Tone polite? Yes.
    • Terms explained? Yes.

    Let's write it out.
